title: Australia Day ideas!
body:
Hey everyone!

I'm throwing cultural events at our Riot North America office for each of the countries that we have offices in and guess what?  It looks like Australia Day is next on the calendar b/c of our Sydney office!  I'm looking for fun ideas so that our NA Rioters can get a genuine and good feel for the culture and fun of Australia!  

Here are some ideas/plans of what I have so far:

1.  Assorted meat pies for lunch
2.  Tim Tam Slam Contest - Who can drink a cup of milk the fastest with their Tim Tam
3.  Tim Tam Wave - We'll be recording about a hundred Rioters dunking their Tim Tams in milk and drinking it in a wave/domino effect
4.  Milo tasting station
5.  Vegemite tasting station
6.  Info boards with different Australian lingo (i.e. maccas, brekkie, sheila, bloke, jandals, dunny, "sweet as")... got any more ideas?
7.  Info boards about the beautiful landmarks (i.e. Opera House, Great Barrier Reef, Uluru-Kata Tjuta National Park, Sydney Harbour Bridge, any more?)
8.  Info board about the different type of accents spoken in different parts of the country
9.  Me wearing a scary bear outfit and pretending to be a drop bear (rawr!)


There's a lot of ideas there... but I want more!  If you could think of a cool activity or anything that you think would be a positive learning experience for our NA Rioters, please do share!  I appreciate it!

replies.body: Show them the epic Australian skin for a champion you've spent years and years preparing for!
I second this.
it was Outback {{champion:58}}
There has to be some form of Cricket game, specifically with an Esky as the wickets :))))))))
Wow, that's a racial stereotype if I have ever seen one.

For landmarks, mount kosciuszko is the tallest mountain in Australia.

Australians like barbecues and beer = normal.

I don't think it's racist either.

If you say Blacks like fried chicken that's racial stereotypes.

If you say Australians like BBQ and beers that is national stereotypes.

Both are stupid so it doesn't matter which one is which tbh.

>Australia Day

>No copious amounts of alcohol

That's what it's all about

And a pool

And a Barbeque

And Fairy Bread

Remember: Only use a little bit of vegemite on buttered bread or toast, like dip the tip of your knife and spread it across maybe three times if it's your first time trying vegemite.

And use a %%%%load of milo, I mean like, half the cup is milo, in order to get the good chocolatey malty goodness.

Ideas-

* Construct your own pavlovas stations or some other food construction stations. (Premade pavlovas & they add whatever fruit & whatnot)
* Little competitions/games with Aussie themed prizes (eg. Those little tourist koala keychain stuff xD, Tim Tams, jar of Vegemite etc.)
* You can make quizzes using information from the Info Boards. Correct answers/winners get prizes.
* Taste test game using Aussie foods.
Kangaroo Boxing ring and a backdoor cricket game with lots of eskies full of beer
Show 'em our sports, our slang (barbie, arvo etc) and possibly didgeridoos :D

We need some kind of memorial for Steve Irwin I think. Screw Chuck Norris, Steve is **the** man!
Find a stream/video of cricket and then get them to commentate it over lunch, because they probably have no idea what's going on and I think it'd make for some good laughs. That or some AFL.
Eh I hate being lumped in with the Australian stereotypes.
